```{r minard_data, include = FALSE}
troops <- read_table("../data/minard-troops.txt")
cities <- read_table("../data/minard-cities.txt")
```

```{r plot_troops, include = FALSE}
plot_troops <- ggplot(troops, aes(long, lat)) +
  geom_path(aes(size = survivors,
                color = direction,
                group = group))
plot_troops
```

```{r plot_both, include = FALSE}
plot_both <- plot_troops + 
  geom_text(data = cities, aes(label = city), size = 4)
plot_both
```

```{r plot_polished, include = FALSE}
plot_polished <- plot_both + 
  scale_size(range = c(0, 12),
             breaks = c(10000, 20000, 30000),
             labels = c("10,000", "20,000", "30,000")) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c("tan", "grey50")) +
  coord_map() +
  labs(title = "Map of Napoleon's Russian campaign of 1812",
       x = NULL,
       y = NULL)
plot_polished
```

```{r plot_final, echo = FALSE}
plot_polished +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

## (Contiguous) United States

```{r all-50, echo = FALSE}
library(maptools)
library(rgeos)
library(rgdal)

#state shape file from
# http://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=f7f805eb65eb4ab787a0a3e1116ca7e5
loc <- file.path(tempdir(), "stats_dat")
unzip(system.file("extdata", "states_21basic.zip", package = "fiftystater"),
      exdir = loc)
fifty_states_sp <- readOGR(dsn = loc, layer = "states", verbose = FALSE)

fifty_states_sp %>%
  fortify(region = "STATE_NAME") %>%
  mutate(id = tolower(id)) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) + 
  coord_fixed(1.3) + 
  geom_polygon(color = "black", fill = "gray")
```

## Using shapefiles

* `.dbf` - data associated with the geographic features

## Loading the data {.scrollable}

```{r county-shp, echo = FALSE}
# load USA shapefile for map boundaries
usa <- readOGR("../data/census_bureau/cb_2013_us_state_20m/cb_2013_us_state_20m.shp")

# fortify and filter to keep contiguous USA
usa2 <- usa %>%
  fortify(region = "GEOID") %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  left_join(usa@data, by = c("id" = "GEOID")) %>%
  # filter out Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico via FIPS codes
  filter(!(STATEFP %in% c("02", "15", "72")))

# do the same thing for the county shapefile
counties <- readOGR("../data/census_bureau/cb_2013_us_county_20m/cb_2013_us_county_20m.shp")

counties2 <- counties %>%
  fortify(region = "GEOID") %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  left_join(counties@data, by = c("id" = "GEOID")) %>%
  # filter out Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico via FIPS codes
  filter(!(STATEFP %in% c("02", "15", "72")))

# plot county map boundaries
ggplot(counties2, mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) + 
  geom_polygon(color = "black", fill = "gray") +
  coord_map()
```

## Get world fertility rate data {.scrollable}

```{r world-shape, echo = FALSE}
# import and fortify world shapefile
world <- readOGR("../data/nautral_earth/ne_110m_admin_0_countries/ne_110m_admin_0_countries.shp")
world2 <- fortify(world, region = "iso_a3")
 
# Country-level data
(fertility <- read_csv("../data/API_SP.DYN.TFRT.IN_DS2_en_csv_v2/API_SP.DYN.TFRT.IN_DS2_en_csv_v2.csv") %>%
  select(-X62) %>%
  # tidy the data frame
  gather(year, fertility, `1960`:`2016`, convert = TRUE) %>%
  filter(year < 2015) %>%
  mutate(fertility = as.numeric(fertility),
         # cut into six intervals
         fertility_rate = cut_interval(fertility, 6)))
```

## `For` loop {.scrollable}

```{r world-plot-for}
for(year in seq(from = 1970, to = 2010, by = 5)){
  p <- fertility %>%
    filter(year == year) %>%
    ggplot(aes(map_id = `Country Code`)) +
    geom_map(aes(fill = fertility_rate), map = world2) +
    expand_limits(x = world2$long, y = world2$lat) +
    scale_fill_brewer(palette = "BuGn") +
    labs(title = "Fertility rate",
         subtitle = year,
         fill = NULL) +
    ggthemes::theme_map() +
    coord_map(projection = "mollweide", xlim = c(-180, 180))
  print(p)
}
```
